intro: Senecio monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, fleshy fruits called cypsela. Senecio monanthos is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
